thread.title: Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake
thread.title_full: Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake

author: DOUG FERGUSON
title: Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake
text:
Woohae Cho Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
International team player Danny Lee of New Zealand walks with playing partner Sangmoon Bae of South Korea during their four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Woohae Cho) Lee Jin-man Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
International team player Sangmoon Bae of South Korea hits a tee shot on the fourth hole during his four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Woohae Cho Mickelson uses wrong ball, US penalized 2 holes 
United States' Phil Mickelson hits from the rough on the second hole during his four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Woohae Cho) Lee Jin-man Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
United States' Zach Johnson, left, watches his tee shot on the fifth hole as teammate Phil Mickelson looks on during their four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Lee Jin-man Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
International team player Louis Oosthuizen of South Africa watches his tee shot on the second hole during his four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Ahn Young-joon Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
International team player Charl Schwartzel of South Africa reacts after sinking a putt on the 13th hole during his four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon) Ahn Young-joon Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
International team player Thongchai Jaidee, right, of Thailand walks with playing partner International team player Charl Schwartzel of South Africa during their four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon) Lee Jin-man Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
United States' Jordan Spieth plays out of the rough on the second hole during his four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Posted: Friday, October 9, 2015 5:47 am | Updated: 7:00 am, Fri Oct 9, 2015. Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake Associated Press | 0 comments 
INCHEON, South Korea (AP) — Bae Sang-moon delivered the biggest moment of his career. Phil Mickelson made a rookie mistake. All that really mattered Friday in the Presidents Cup was that the International team was back in business. 
Bae made a dynamic debut at home in his first Presidents Cup by making a 12-foot birdie putt on the 18th hole to win a crucial fourballs match that helped the International team win its first team session in four years and pull within one point of the United States. kAmQx <?6H :E H2D 2 C62==J[ C62==J 3:8 AFEE[Q q26 D2:5[ A=2J:?8 7@C E96 =2DE E:>6 367@C6 96 DE2CED 9:D >2?52E@CJ >:=:E2CJ D6CG:46]k^Am kAmqC2?56? vC246 2?5 {@F:D ~@DE9F:K6?
